abstract: The retailer said it would terminate coverage for about 5 percent of its part-time force because of cost increases under the Affordable Care Act.
snippet: The retailer said it would terminate coverage for about 5 percent of its part-time force because of cost increases under the Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: Walmart Stores, the world’s largest retailer and the nation’s largest private employer, said on Tuesday that it would terminate health insurance coverage for about 30,000 part-time workers, joining a string of retailers that have rolled back benefits in response to the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Walmart to End Health Coverage for 30,000 Part-Time Workers
headline.print_headline: 30,000 Lose Health Care Coverage at Walmart

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
